etymologies: mid 18th century: from bane in the sense ‘poison’ + berry

definitions: a plant of the buttercup family that bears fluffy spikes of creamy-white flowers followed by shiny berries. Native to north temperate regions, it was formerly used in medicine.

notes.text: Genus Actaea, family Ranunculaceae: many species, including the North American white baneberry (A. pachypoda), with clusters of black-eyed white berries on red stalks

shortDefinitions: plant of buttercup family, which bears fluffy spikes of creamy-white flowers followed by shiny berries

definitions: the bitter, typically poisonous berry of the baneberry plant.
